sentences.english: And when it was made plain who Kino was, the doctor grew stern and judicious at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 弄清楚誰是吉納後，醫生變得嚴肅認真而又明智起來。

sentences.english: Welcome to Hema News. The lastest and finest Chinese News.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到河馬新聞，最熱門最嚴肅的華語新聞。

sentences.english: A more serious talk can begin with a quotation or a thoughtful question.
sentences.chinese: 較嚴肅的主題可由一句引言或引人深思的問題開始。

sentences.english: With great seriousness he pondered upon the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他極其嚴肅地仔細考慮問題。

sentences.english: Land acquisition and demolition of illegal behavior, according to the law severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 對違法違規徵地拆遷行爲，依法依規嚴肅查處。

sentences.english: In the most serious frame of mind Pierre drove up to the old prince's house.
sentences.chinese: 皮埃爾懷着極其嚴肅的心情乘車去老公爵家。

sentences.english: She did all this with the same compressed lips, and the same stony look .
sentences.chinese: 她做着這些事情，依然是咬緊了嘴脣，神情十分嚴肅。

sentences.english: This is why we go on, day after day, concocting fictions with utter seriousness .
sentences.chinese: 這就是我們爲何日復一日，如此嚴肅編織小說的原因。

sentences.english: Our jobs, as affiliate marketers, are very real.
sentences.chinese: 其實聯屬網絡營銷是個非常嚴肅和真實的工作。

sentences.english: Amused by her mock seriousness, I moved to her right breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的故作嚴肅真好玩，我就湊向她的右乳。

sentences.english: CIOs are not seriously thinking about Cloud Computing
sentences.chinese: CIO們仍然沒有嚴肅認真地去考慮過雲計算。

sentences.english: Unfathomable was the depth of his gravity.
He's a composer of serious music. I like his music a lot.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位嚴肅音樂作曲家，我非常喜歡他的音樂。

sentences.english: You have boring, and rational, and precised leaders.
sentences.chinese: 也有嚴肅乏味理智冷靜，但又精確全面的領導者。

sentences.english: Rumbold. Mrs. Rumbold was a large, unsmiling lady in a tight black dress.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個很高大，嚴肅的穿着緊身黑裙子的夫人。

sentences.english: A serious political speech should not be full of frivolities .
sentences.chinese: 一篇嚴肅的政治演講不該充斥着輕薄無聊的話。

definition: conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
